title: ICAI Releases Exposure Draft of Guidance Note on Audit of Banks (2026 Edition)
content:
# ICAI Releases Exposure Draft of Guidance Note on Audit of Banks (2026 Edition)

Ek important update hai! The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) ne **Guidance Note on Audit of Banks (2026 Edition)** ka Exposure Draft release kiya hai. This is a crucial step to ensure that bank audits remain robust and aligned with the latest industry practices.

Here's a quick rundown of what CAs need to know:

*   **What it is:** This Exposure Draft provides updated insights, standards, and methodologies for Chartered Accountants to effectively conduct audits in India's dynamic banking sector. It aims to equip auditors with the necessary tools to navigate the complexities of bank audits.
*   **Why it's important:** The draft incorporates recent changes in banking regulations, technological advancements (especially in digital banking), and updated risk management procedures. This ensures that bank audits are performed with accuracy and transparency, adhering to the highest professional standards.
*   **Call for Comments:** The ICAI's Auditing and Assurance Standards Board (AASB) has invited stakeholders, including auditors, banking professionals, and regulators, to provide their valuable comments and feedback on this Exposure Draft. This collaborative approach helps in finalising a comprehensive and practical guidance note. The last date for submitting comments is March 14, 2026.
